channel.title: Donator and Weapon Stats
channel.description:
Donator: In the character files, the donator status says "donor:false" or "donor:true". Now in making the donator zone, i dont know what i need to put for the character rights to be in the command, so only donators can go to the donator zone. Help would be much appreciated :D (THIS IS A 517 SOURCE)
Weapon Stats: In my source, weapons are a little "under powered", and would like them to have a little bit more power to them. I dont know exactly what file i would look under to find the weapons, so if anyone could help, that would be great! (THIS IS ALSO A 517 SOURCE)

item.title: Donator and Weapon Stats
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Weapons stats are usually in
Bin -> Data -> Items -> Items.cfg

Read full topic

item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

It is not a Java source file… Look for a different file.

} else if (weapon.contains(“Dragon claws”)) {
p.getActionSender().setInterfaceConfig(p, 78, 12, false);

item.title: Donator and Weapon Stats

@deathschaos9 wrote:

wrong file, your looking for a txt/xml/cfg file, not a Java file.

item.title: Donator and Weapon Stats
item.dc:creator: @h3rbl0re h3rbl0re
item.description:
@h3rbl0re wrote:

I found the items, but this is what is says for dragon claws.

} else if (weapon.endsWith(“claws”)) {
p.getActionSender().setTab(p, 73, 78);
p.getActionSender().setString(p, weapon, 78, 0);
p.weaponType = 11;

Where do i change how hard they hit?

Read full topic

item.title: Donator and Weapon Stats
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

  1. 517 Is not a revision its a 508 loading 525 cache. Saying 517 makes you look stupid.

@Topic

  1. Start off the command as

if (cmd[0].startsWith("donatorzone")) { if(p.donator) { //Send to donator zone } else { //What to do if donator is not true } }

Not 100% if p.donator will work, but that’s the general idea.

  1. I’m not sure as to where the item configurations are on a 508/525 source, but look in the bin folder for something called “item” or “itemdefinitions” and look for the weapon in there.

Read full topic
